* Our apologies if you receive multiple copies of this email. *

We are happy to announce the release of the Grid-Soccer Simulator 1.0
and the accompanied agents:
http://gridsoccer.codeplex.com

Grid-Soccer Simulator, is a grid-world environment in which two teams
of agents play soccer together. The main intention behind developing
this environment, is to provide a test-bed for reinforcement learning,
and learning in cooperative, competitive, and mixed multi-agent
environments. The communication between the environment and the
clients is done through a text-based network protocol; thus, one can
create a client in any desired programming language as long as that
language supports networking. Currently there are several agents
developed in C# and sample agents in C++ and Java, which can be easily
extended to fit one's experiments' needs.

The developers believe, this environment is useful also for teaching
and demonstrating related fields in the class, or defining proper
assignments for the students.

Please read the user's manual to get more information about the environment:
User's Manual: http://gridsoccer.codeplex.com/releases/view/64543

The developers appreciate any kind of feedback ranging from bug report
to feature suggestion. Please let us know if you plan to use this
environment in your research or classroom.

Thanks,
The Grid-Soccer Simulator Developers
Sina Iravanian
Sahar Araghi
